title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9660.2 - Fraud and abuse
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9660.2 - Fraud and abuse

State Regulations
(a) The
executive director shall maintain a statewide program for investigation and
referral for prosecution of violations of State laws pertaining to fraud or
abuse in the program. (b) Where
initial review of a contractor referral indicates substantial potential for
criminal prosecution, the executive director shall refer the matter to the

Attorney General or local prosecutive authority. Where initial review does not
indicate substantial potential for criminal prosecution, the executive director
shall conduct further review to determine whether or not a participant's
participation in the program should be restricted or terminated. (c) Where review indicates substantial
evidence of abusive practices, the participant may be removed from the program
or restricted to a single provider. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
9660.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
